intro: Lomaria campylotis, commonly known as the curly dock, is a perennial herb native to the Americas. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants like sorrel and knotweed. The plant is characterized by its thick, ribbed stems and heart-shaped leaves that are often covered in a white, waxy coating. Its small, greenish flowers appear in clusters and are typically pollinated by insects. Lomaria campylotis is often found in moist soils along stream banks and in disturbed areas.
